{{Quote|Not much use are you, you little snufflers?|One Orc-hunter to another|<ref>{{RK|VI2}}</ref>}}

'''Orc-hunters'''<ref name=identity>''[[The Chronology of The Lord of the Rings]]'', p. 74</ref> were [[Orcs]] which excelled in tracking<ref name=shadow>{{RK|VI2}}, pp. 924-6</ref> that roamed the regions of [[Beleriand]] and [[Middle-earth]] under the rule of [[Morgoth]] and later [[Sauron]].

== History ==
Sometime in or prior to the year {{FA|496}} during the late [[First Age]], one particular band of Orc-hunters roamed the region of [[Methiriad]] near the [[Nivrim|West March]] of the [[Doriath]].<ref>{{UT|2i}}</ref>

In the year 496 after the [[Dragons|dragon]] [[Glaurung]] erased [[Nienor]]'s memory, [[Mablung]] and his company found her on [[Amon Ethir]] and began to make their way slowly back to Doriath. After many days, they reached a guarded bridge over the [[Taeglin]] and decided to rest there. However, a roaming "band of Orc-hunters" attacked them unawares, causing Nienor to flee into [[Brethil]] in terror and confusion. When the Orc-hunters pursued her, she outran them and they were overtaken and killed by the [[Elves]].<ref name=band>{{CH|14}}</ref>

On [[16 March]] in the year {{TA|3019}} of the late [[Third Age]], [[Frodo Baggins]] and [[Samwise Gamgee]] spied two Orc-hunters<ref name=identity/> near the [[Sauron's Road|Barad-dûr Road]]<ref>''[[The Chronology of The Lord of the Rings]]'', p. 148</ref> having a disagreement twenty paces away from them regarding their mission. One of them stated that their bosses [[Barad-dûr|Higher Up]] kept changing their target; from an Elf to a [[Dwarves|dwarf]]-[[Men|man]], to even "a pack of rebel [[Uruk-hai]]" in the context of the [[Battle of Cirith Ungol|quarrel]] in the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]]. As a result of this, he suggested that it could be all three put together in fact. Following the disagreement, the snuffling Orc skillfully killed the larger one with an arrow and ran off to a nearby [[Orc-holds|Orc-hold]].<ref name=shadow/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In a sketch predating the earliest form of the story of [[Túrin]], Nienor was driven into some woods by a baneful drink given to her by [[Kurúki]],<ref name=Kurúki>{{LT2|IIn}}, pp. 138-40</ref> instead of a group of Orc-hunters<ref name=band/>.

In a discarded revision of chapter five of ''[[The Hobbit]]'', [[Gollum]] is described as a "foul orc-<illegible>" by [[Bilbo Baggins]]. [[John D. Rateliff]] notes that, though the second half of the word is illegible, it was probably "hunter" and not "thing" because the word lacked "a descender at the end".<ref>{{HH|1947}}, i. ''Proposed correction of Hobbit to simplify Sequel (Gollum does not give ring).'', note 37</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''2022: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'', Season One:'''
:'''Episode 7: ''[[The Eye]]'':'''
::When [[Galadriel]] and [[Theo]] hide from the Orcs beneath a log, a '''Hunter Orc''', portrayed by [[Jed Brophy]], attempts to sniff them out. When another Orc, portrayed by [[Robert Strange]] and credited as "Other Orc", asks him what it is that he smells, the Hunter Orc answers that he smells nothing but ash.
